nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.stats.general

Class FilterUsed

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.stats.general.FilterUsed

  • public class FilterUsed
extends java.lang.Object
    A value object capturing the use of filters. For each used filter, define an object of this class. To add a new filter type to be shown is very simple:
    1. add a type to the FilterType enum
    2. give the key for its column header right there when defining it
    3. Define a setFilter method version in StatisticalResultDTO that allows you to call and pass the filter from the Service.
    Author:
    Rinke

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterUsed

        public FilterUsed(FilterUsed.FilterType filterType,
          java.util.List<java.lang.String> names)
        constructor to add a multi drop down selector filter to the "Used filters" overview below each graph or table.
        Parameters:
        filterType - the FilterType of this Filter.
        names - a List of Strings containing the names of the elements of the filter. These will ususally be the paymentFilter names or group names selected in the filter. Note that these names are NOT considered to be keys for the language resource bundle; they are printed "as is".

      • FilterUsed

        public FilterUsed(FilterUsed.FilterType filterType,
          java.lang.String selectedName)
        constructor for the normal use of filters, where only one item can be selected. The name of this item is shown in the "filters used" box below each graph or table.
        Parameters:
        filterType - the FilterType of this filter.
        selectedName - a String which is the name of the selected item. This is placed "as is" and not looked up in the language resource bundle.

    • Method Detail

      • noFilterUsed

        public static FilterUsed noFilterUsed(FilterUsed.FilterType filterType)
        pseudo-constructor for constructing an item in the "Filters used" box which declares the filter is not used. "Not used" in this context means, that the filter was displayed on the form, but is not used for generating this dataset. If the filter was not used but is not relevant at all, and wasn't even on the form, then don't use this construct and just do nothing.
        Parameters:
        filterType - the FilterType which is not used.
        Returns:
        a FilterUsed object for displaying "not used" in this box.

      • nothingSelected

        public static FilterUsed nothingSelected(FilterUsed.FilterType filterType,
                         java.lang.String nothingSelectedKey)
        pseudo-constructor for the "nothing selected" filter selections, where one string is shown to represent the filter value.
        Parameters:
        filterType - the FilterType of this filter.
        nothingSelectedKey - a String which describes the status when nothing is selected. Usually this will be something like "All Payments" or "All Members". Remember that this must be the key for this String, as the strings itself reside in the language resource bundle.
        Returns:
        a FilterUsed object for displaying messages like "All Payments" in the "Filters used" box.

      • addBlankRows

        public void addBlankRows(int rowsToAdd)
        ads blank rows to a list. Called from the DataProducer, in order to make sure all columns are of equal length.
        Parameters:
        rowsToAdd - the number of blank rows to add to the value list.

      • changeKeyToValue

        public void changeKeyToValue(java.lang.String key,
                    java.lang.String message)
        replaces a resource bundle key in the values List to its message value. To be called from the StatisticalDataProducer.
        Parameters:
        key - the key as it appears in the language resource bundle
        message - its corresponding value from that bundle.
